message_1: In a sealed-bid first-price auction, there are three bidders: A, B, and C. Each bidder submits a single bid on an item that they value at $200. Bidder A submits a bid of $150, bidder B submits a bid of $175, and bidder C submits a bid of $200. Who wins the auction and what is the amount they pay?
message_2: In a sealed-bid first-price auction, the highest bidder wins the auction and pays the amount they bid. In this case, bidder C submitted the highest bid of $200. Therefore, bidder C wins the auction and pays $200.
